content.description: Same start as Schlitz (side-pull in the middle of the wall). Reach up and way right to sharp jug and then top out to the right. Like other road soda problems, the ground is usually wet

This is a left-to-right traverse of almost the whole length of the Road Soda boulder (the face that's right along the road). Start on the slopy ridge with bad left foot and no right foot. Slap up the ridge until you can get feet on the nice low ledge and rock over with undercling and frictiony holds. Stay high for a few moves then transition low with good undercling and smeary feet. Top out just above the white crystally crater (using the crater as a foot).Adding another move or two right would involve some small handholds and would make it much harder.
content.location: Start on the left side of the Road Soda boulder

content.description: Start on side-pull and bad feet. Go left to undercling or a big right cross up high. Traverse left for a move or two and then top out on rough slopers. The landing area is wet most of the time.

Crouch-start on the crimps. First move is a right gaston, then step up and hit the slopers to top out. The bottom of this boulder is often wet (it's the road ditch), so best to do it when it's very dry or very cold.
content.location: Left side of the Road Soda Boulder.
